properties.name: Aristotle University of Thessaloniki
properties.description: Posted by Aleanayoungthessaloniki, GreeceThis is not where Aristotle went to school, but this is a contribution to him. He is considered the "Historical First" (In psy.research) because he was the first person to study the nature of thought and mind by a method of natural science. Most of the first psychologist were actually philosophers, untill it formed a new science withen itself.

properties.name: Cornell University
properties.description: Posted by AleanayoungEnglandEdward Titchener came to Cornell University in 1892 to direct a psychology laboratory. He is responsible for a movement called structuralism.

properties.name: Furman University
properties.description: Posted by AleanayoungJames B. Watson\'s approach to studing psychology was through observing human behavior. Thus he created a movement that was popular from 1900 through the 1950\'s called Behaviorism. He did not think that studing thought, mind, and consciousness were relavant to understanding psychology; Only what could be observed. This is not how most view it today, but his consepts still play a part in helping people to understand the human psyche.

properties.name: Harvard University
properties.description: Posted by Aleanayoung1350 massachusets Avenue, Cambridge, MAThis is were William James developed an approach to psychology called funtionalism. (How the brain and mind, Function). He was the first American psycholgist/philosopher to contribute research to this field.

properties.name: Hauptuni
properties.description: Posted by AleanayoungVienna, AustriaThis is The University of Vienna in Austria. Here is the institution of Sigmund Freud. He is considered, "The father of psychoanalysis". Also known for theories on reppresion, transference, dream intrepretation, and the unconsious mind.

properties.name: University of Leipzig
properties.description: Posted by AleanayoungLeipzig, Germany This is one of the first Universities for psychological research directed by William Wundt. He directed more than 200 doctorial theses on psychological topics. He created the first psychological system. His method is of self observation, called introspection. Hermann von Ebbinghaus also came here and followed his research, branching out to Cognitive processes.

properties.name: University of Padua
properties.description: Posted by AleanayoungPisa, ItalyAlthough Galileo Galilei was not a phychologist, he was very influential to mankind. He worked along with Descartes and together, they created a revolution that altered the human perseptions of reality. He is a great inspiration to me.

properties.name: University of Poitiers
properties.description: Posted by AleanayoungPoitiers, FranceThis is were Descartes went to college. He was a factor in the scientific revoultion, but also left an important mark on psychology. He started the movement of rationalism. "I think therefore I am"

properties.name: University of Tennesse
properties.description: Posted by Aleanayoung1600 Phil Fulmer Ave # 200, Knoxville, TNI wanted to put UT in here because this is where I will most likely attend graduate school and here will be the birth of my own psychological research. I would love to go to Europe and study at one of the other Universities posted, but most likely, I will stay in the states. I want to acknowledge those that have inspired me here in my field, To Mark Daniels who is a Grad student (My Humanistic psy teacher) and who studies under Dr. Pollio, who wrote our texbook on existentialism. Also, my cognition professor who is a "famous" mnesist, Dr. Srinivasan Madevan.

properties.name: University of Wurzburg
properties.description: Posted by AleanayoungWurzburg, GermanyThis is where Max Wertheimer taught psychology and did research. He was one of the Founders of Gestalt Psychology. "The sum of its parts are different than the whole". Figure and Ground. Etc. Highly influential to this day.
